title: "scuttle timer raised"
body:
So we give you some of the loudest feed back of anger we have ever given you about a patch/idea and you insist on keeping it instead of just reverting back to the old scuttle system? 

This might actually be the season that drives me to quitting league of legends. 

I can't handle another whole year where the community is literally and only asking for one thing, one thing we all agree that's terrible, and riot refuses to answer it.

Season 6-We beg for for solo back, it didn't happen till season 7

season 7- We beg for ardent nerfs, didn't happen till season 8

Season 8: the year of the scuttle

I legit just can't emotionally handle of the same bull over and over again, where a rioter creates a legitimately terrible idea, and the rioter insists that his idea is good, some how gets someone higher up to agree to it, and because of that the entire community has to actually suffer from it. 

The thing that hurts the game the most is literally the design teams ego trying to force bad ideas down the balance teams throats for Big boss men say "MAKE IT WORK".

It's literally not even the balance teams fault, you can't balance an idea that is fundamentally horrible. All  you can do is nerf it to the ground until it no longer exists.

Edit: Let's not forget how stone plate basically got nerfed into none existence

when you have both regular players as well as pro-players and high elo streamers,( see meteos, dom, scara, qtpie, levie etc) saying that this change is horrible, there has to be some truth somewhere.

The truth is players dont know how to balance games. Players are good at telling you something is wrong, players are bad at telling you what is wrong. You should pretty much never listen to a player who tells you they know whats wrong, they dont.
Well, look, here we are, players, telling you that "something is wrong with the jungle now, that wasn't a couple of patches ago. I wonder what it could be?"
Sure, something may be wrong. Guess what it likely isnt? Scuttle.

"Something is forcing the jungles to play one, distinct style that alienates most of the champion pool, causing early game junglers to run rampant over their competition, killing diversity instead of helping it, making it so that they are often behind in levels at key points in the game, enforcing snowballing even more than it already was, causing the role itself to feel underwhelming, and making it so that jungle now seems to be the most ganked role in the game. Now, if only we could identify some kind of turning point where this seemed to have happened."

Oh wait

That would be true in a vaccume, but riot can do a myriad of other things to adjust post change other than reverting the change.

Even the "ADC issue" wasnt ADCs are OP, it was non early game ADCs got nerfed repeatedly to the point where crit scaling ADCs were the only option. Guess what the solution was? Buffing ADCs and giving them more items for non crit scaling champions. You know, the thing no one said?

that is total bs.

The ADC issue was ADCs came online at 2-2.5 items. 

"Late game scaling" that was achieved at 15-20 minutes. Completely asinine.

2.5-3 items is about where you want late game ADCs to start to function. Else youre useless for the entire game and might as well not even play (average game time is sub 30 mins)

Issue wasnt really that crit scaling was OP, it was every early game ADC's build path was nerfed to the ground. BC/Lethality ADC builds were shot, PTA was nerfed, Tempo was always garbage, ambient goldgen was upped making crit builds better, and most early game ADCs got nerfs in the past (lucian being the big example).

The fix was slightly shifting back crit items, and adding more power to early game ADC itemization, the buffs being the bigger player as to what will actually fix the ADC issue.

I kinda agree with you. However 'starting to function' is not the same as instantly becoming the highest damage character in the game upon completion. To the extent that some friends and I played rather successfully with two separate styles. 4 adc's and a support. And 4 supports and an adc.

4 ADC comps wouldnt really work in a real game. You lack protection and will just get CCd to hell and back. It doesnt matter how much damage you can do if you die before you can do any.

4 supports is much more reasonable, as the support class has a variety of champs who can typically function in other lanes to some extent as well.

I have been playing since season 5 and out of all the crap Rito has done to this game thus far, I have remained a diehard and loyal fan. I fell in love with this game. My favourite role was jungle and I played it literally 90% of matches over the years. Every time I logged on and called "jg"I felt right at home. 

When I heard about the scuttle changes and saw all the negative reactions regarding it, I honestly didn't think it was going to have that much of an impact. "The community is just overreacting" I said to myself. Oh boy how wrong I was! The scuttle changes didn't just affect the jungle, it literally impacted every single lane and every game since has been a hussle over who can get the scuttle first; and then proceed to fight over the next scuttle spawns for the next 10 to 20 mins. I'm not going to mention all of the other issues this change has caused, as I'm sure everyone on this thread has covered those parts.

It's ruined the only role I genuinely enjoy, and I know Rito aren't going to revert the changes until next season (if they revert it at all). And I am not waiting that long for them to fix it.

I have sunk over $200 into this game and I now regret supporting a company that honestly couldn't give a rats arse about its community. You used to care Riot, but now the fat cat on top of the pyramid is fatter than ever and it's hunger for money will never be sated.

You have driven me to quit League, Riot. This is the straw that broke the camel's back, and you will be your own undoing when this game eventually dies.

It's time that I move on. So long and gg fellow summoners.

> [{quoted}](name=BrendoRockLee,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=uAdflTIZ,comment-id=0015,timestamp=2018-05-24T18:02:25.065+0000)
> When I heard about the scuttle changes and saw all the negative reactions regarding it, I honestly didn't think it was going to have that much of an impact. "The community is just overreacting" I said to myself. Oh boy how wrong I was! The scuttle changes didn't just affect the jungle, it literally impacted every single lane and every game since has been a hussle over who can get the scuttle first; and then proceed to fight over the next scuttle spawns for the next 10 to 20 mins. I'm not going to mention all of the other issues this change has caused, as I'm sure everyone on this thread has covered those parts.

They didn't realize that there are consequences for one jungler getting behind another jungler so early without a way to catch up. - consequences that impact every lane during the lane phase, and thus the whole game.

That's why everyone is in a mad dash to help their jungler secure the scuttle, if they are high enough elo to realize they need to, out of a sense of self preservation - they don't want to have to get constantly ganked all lane phase, uncontested by their own jungler, just because their jungler didn't get the scuttle crabs.

This is not what they could have intended to happen. Now it's the laners job to babysit the jungler, instead of the other way around.

In past jungles, you could get behind, but that was because the jungler made some plays to get you behind. Because the jungles were always even by design. If they invaded your jungle in one spot you could counter potentially by invading another spot in theirs (even if you were behind, you could hit parts of their jungle that they weren't near without having to fight them). 
But with the new changes, you automatically get put behind just by virtue of not picking from a narrow pool of champions who cannot contest scuttle. Because the design is not even. But the scuttle makes the entire scenario asymetrical and forces one side to get an advantage because you can't respond tit for tat. You take my buff, I take yours on the other side of the jungle. Doesn't work anymore. You take scuttle, I get nothing, because there's only one.One side is guaranteed to get an advantage, by design. And then they can press that advantage to widen it, never losing it.

There is nothing comparable to this in laning. It would be like having a neutral minion pop up in the lane at random times, then whoever landed the last hit on it first got a big amount of exp and gold. That would totally trash laning dynamics.

Riot, as a company, is extremely proud. They don't like to go back on their decisions even if it turns out to be a clearly bad decision. That's their fatal flaw.

They'll probably fiddle around with Scuttle, attempting to make it healthier, before either reworking or reverting it in a few months.

It's happened before, it'll happen again. It's not a very intelligent business plan, IMO, but it's worked for them so far...

At least we know League won't die due to this change alone, as similar ones have happened in the past.
